Based on the user's preferences and genre, I would recommend "Die Hard" to them.
"Die Hard" is a classic action movie directed by John McTiernan. The movie stars Bruce Willis as John Rambo, an experienced Special Forces soldier who returns home after serving his country in a war against their enemies.
When he returns home, John Rambo finds that his family has been killed in a mysterious event. Determined to find the cause of his family's deaths, John Rambo sets out on a journey through hostile terrain, seeking answers to his family's deaths.
Throughout his journey, John Rambo encounters many different people and creatures, each with their own unique characteristics and abilities.
As John Rambo continues his journey, he eventually discovers the cause of his family's deaths. With this newfound knowledge, John Rambo is able to bring closure to the events that have caused him so much heartache and suffering.
Overall, "Die Hard" is a classic action movie that is sure to provide audiences with plenty of excitement and thrills.

Both of these movies are based on the idea that women have a different way of thinking than men do. 

In "Princess Mononoke", Ashitaka discovers that the people in his village were killed by Tatarigami, a kind of magic that can be used to cause harm or death. 

Ashitaka is forced to make a choice between protecting his people or taking action against the Tatarigami. 

In "The Andromeda Strain", the story follows the progress of a deadly virus that is rapidly spreading around the world. The virus, which is named after the constellation Andromeda, appears to be highly contagious and can easily spread from person to person without any visible symptoms being present.
